alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Coastal Waldo; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Sagadahoc; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 25 at 3:19AM EST until February 26 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SNOWSTORM TO IMPACT THE REGION TODAY... .Low pressure will track out of the Ohio Valley this early morning and cross southern New England today bringing periods of moderate to heavy snowfall across portions of New Hampshire and southwestern Maine. The heaviest snowfall is expected to fall from Friday morning through the early evening hours. Significant travel impacts are expected. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 8 inches. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to low visibility and snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will be heaviest this afternoon with the greatest impacts expected.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
